meanings.definition: Struggle to surmount (a difficulty or danger).
meanings.sent1: She had to contend with a steep hill on her way to school every day.
meanings.sent2: The hiker had to contend with a sudden storm while climbing the mountain.
meanings.sent3: Trying to cook a new recipe without a recipe book was a real contend for her.
meanings.sent4: The young entrepreneur had to contend with fierce competition in the market.
meanings.sent5: The knight had to contend with a fire-breathing dragon to rescue the princess.

meanings.definition: Assert something as a position in an argument.
meanings.sent1: He will contend that the Earth is round, not flat.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer will contend that his client is innocent of all charges.
meanings.sent3: She liked to contend that chocolate ice cream was better than vanilla.
meanings.sent4: The politician will contend that his policies are the best for the country.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will contend that reading is the most important skill for students to learn.

meanings.sent1: The athletes will contend for the gold medal in the upcoming competition.
meanings.sent2: The students will contend for the top spot in the spelling bee.
meanings.sent3: The siblings always contend for their parents' attention.
meanings.sent4: The companies will contend for the lucrative contract with the government.
meanings.sent5: The singers will contend for the title of the next singing sensation.
